translated: Verses of the Elders🔽The Fives
The First Chapter
Subhūta🔽A man who wants to do his duty
but applies himself to the wrong thing,
if he does not succeed in his wandering,
‘That is a sign of my bad luck.’
When the unyoked is unyoked, the conquered is conquered,
If one lets go of one, there will be a quarrel;

analyzed: sabbāni pi ce ossajeyya andhaḥ uva siyā
translated: If one lets go of all, one will be blind,
Because of not seeing the level and the uneven.

analyzed: yat hi kayirā tat hi vade
translated: What one does, that one should say;

original: yaṁ na kayirā na taṁ vade;
analyzed: yam na kayirā na tam vade
translated: What one does not do, one should not say;
The wise know
One who speaks without doing.
Just as a beautiful flower
is colorful but has no scent,
So too are well-spoken words
fruitless for one who does not act.
Just as a beautiful flower
is colorful and fragrant,
So too are well-spoken words
fruitful for one who acts.”
… the Elder Subhūta …
